interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Cayman Went
Review Date: 2013/10/02
Store: Michael Lombardi  (Actor),     Jeff Demunn  (Actor),     Bobby Sheehan  (Director, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama
Product Description: ['TV personality Josh Anders (Michael Lombardi, FX’s Rescue Me) is a legend in his own mind … and even he has doubts. Ratings are down and the hottie star of Diver Down (a male Baywatch) can’t get arrested in Hollywood these days. When the smug pretty boy receives an ultimatum from an ultra-wealthy, powerful andunethical resort developer – who also happens to own the network that broadcasts his show – Josh finds himself the key player in a land grab scheme targeting the picturesque, unspoiled and tiny Caribbean island of Cayman Brac.The laid-back locals, most of them big fans, are putty in his hands, except for theeccentric Mr. Bowman (Jeffrey Demunn, Burn After Reading, Hollywoodland, CBS’s Law & Order, The Shawshank Redemption), a cranky retiree who’s never even heard of the show.Secretly petrified of the ocean, Josh just wants to close the deal and go home. That is until Mr. Bowman, a parentless kid named Rodney and Darby Thomas (Susan Misner,Chicago, Eavesdrop), the beautiful but opinionated owner of the local Sand Bar, change his mind about what really matters most.A romantic drama that proves It’s all good … if you just know what to look for.']
Average Rating: 4.0
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Michael Lombardi, Jeff Demunn, Susan Misner, Eyalan Owona, Susan Misner, Michael Lombardi, Jeff Demunn, Jim Ritterhoff, Eyalan Owona, Bobby SheehanMichael Lombardi, Jeff Demunn, Susan Misner, Eyalan Owona, Susan Misner, Michael Lombardi, Jeff Demunn, Jim Ritterhoff, Eyalan Owona, Bobby Sheehan  See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 29 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 3.5 Ounces', 'Director': 'Bobby Sheehan', 'Media Format': 'NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 29 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 19, 2014', 'Actors': 'Michael Lombardi, Jeff Demunn, Susan Misner, Eyalan Owona, Michael Lombardi, Jeff Demunn, Susan Misner, Eyalan Owona', 'Studio': 'Osiris Entertainment', 'Writers': 'Jim Ritterhoff, Bobby Sheehan', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: While this is not an achademy worthy movie it is certainly one I enjoyed.  I've been to Grand Cayman several times and it brought back great memories.
Review Title: nice story
Rating: 4.0

reference_summary:
The Life of Birds
Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Documentary
["The definitive series on the most colorful, popular and perfectly adapted creatures on earth, The Life of Birds traverses the globe, covering 42 countries and examining over 300 different species. Calling upon the immense skills of many of the world's top wildlife cameramen and women, and pushing filming technology to the limits, new behavior is brought to the screen in staggering detail. Infra-red cameras find oilbirds deep in pitch black caves. Ultra slow motion film unravels the complexities of bird flight and ultraviolet cameras reveal the world from a bird's point of view."]
{'Genre': 'Classics, Documentary', 'Format': "Multiple Formats, Box set, Closed-captioned, Full Screen, NTSC, Collector's Edition", 'Contributor': 'David Attenborough', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 2.0)', 'Number Of Discs': '3', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.75 inches; 6.4 Ounces', 'Media Format': "Multiple Formats, Box set, Closed-captioned, Full Screen, NTSC, Collector's Edition", 'Run time': '9 hours', 'Release date': 'September 27, 2005', 'Studio': 'BBC Video', 'Number of discs': '3'}
This was purchased as a gift and was greatly appreciated.  It is always exciting to give something that can be enjoyed by the whole family over and over.
Makes a great gift!
{'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Joe Wright'], 'Producers': ['Tim Bevan', 'Eric Fellner', 'Paul Webster'], 'Starring': ['Keira Knightley', 'Matthew Macfadyen', 'Brenda Blethyn']}
This is one of those classic love stories that you just can't stop watching, over, and over.  You get a true feel for this historical period, without the Hollywood glitter and glamor we so often see. One of my favorite movies.
A true classic!

['TV personality Josh Anders (Michael Lombardi, FX’s Rescue Me) is a legend in his own mind … and even he has doubts. Ratings are down and the hottie star of Diver Down (a male Baywatch) can’t get arrested in Hollywood these days. When the smug pretty boy receives an ultimatum from an ultra-wealthy, powerful andunethical resort developer – who also happens to own the network that broadcasts his show – Josh finds himself the key player in a land grab scheme targeting the picturesque, unspoiled and tiny Caribbean island of Cayman Brac.The laid-back locals, most of them big fans, are putty in his hands, except for theeccentric Mr. Bowman (Jeffrey Demunn, Burn After Reading, Hollywoodland, CBS’s Law & Order, The Shawshank Redemption), a cranky retiree who’s never even heard of the show.Secretly petrified of the ocean, Josh just wants to close the deal and go home. That is until Mr. Bowman, a parentless kid named Rodney and Darby Thomas (Susan Misner,Chicago, Eavesdrop), the beautiful but opinionated owner of the local Sand Bar, change his mind about what really matters most.A romantic drama that proves It’s all good … if you just know what to look for.']

profile:
**User Summary:**

- **Content Focus**: Passionate about documentary films, especially those related to nature and wildlife, while also appreciating classic cinematic love stories with historical depth. Recently, the user demonstrated an enjoyment for romantic dramas that evoke nostalgia and personal reflections on travel experiences.
- **Preferred Format**: Favors DVD, particularly multi-format or collector's editions that provide enhanced viewing experiences, as seen in their preference for high-quality productions.
- **Target Audience**: Seeks family-oriented content appealing to various age groups, perfect for sharing among family members.
- **Gift-Giving**: Enjoys selecting thoughtful gifts that blend education and entertainment, prioritizing impactful and meaningful presents.
- **Quality Appreciation**: Values high production quality and has a keen interest in advanced filming techniques and engaging storytelling, enhancing viewer connection.
- **Emotional Engagement**: Prioritizes items that foster family bonding and create shared experiences, providing positive feedback for emotionally resonant films and narratives.
- **Overall Ratings**: Maintains a positive outlook towards products, often giving high ratings, reflecting a tendency to appreciate quality and meaningful entertainment, even in less critically acclaimed works. The user’s recent interactions underline a consistent longing for emotionally engaging stories that resonate on personal levels.
